name: NPR
text:
Retired four-star Air Force Gen. Chuck Boyd is one of hundreds of military voices endorsing Joe Biden for president.

Boyd, who fought in Vietnam and spent 7 years as a prisoner of war, says a second Trump term would be a danger to democracy.
https://t.co/tRGYQbpHkp

name: NPR
text:
For the first time ever, "The New England Journal of Medicine" has taken a stance on a U.S. presidential election — calling the current administration "dangerously incompetent" in an editorial titled "Dying in a Leadership Vacuum." 
https://t.co/OT6juHV9xY

name: NPR
text: Resentment for Gov. Gretchen Whitmer had been steadily fomenting in two spheres: one in the far-right groups and militias frequenting capitol protests, the other in the Republican majority of the Michigan Legislature. https://t.co/dQaWqfbpef

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: @nprscottsimon remembers New York Times columnist Jim Dwyer, who died from cancer this week at the age of 63.
https://t.co/lRfBtfpPv7

name: NPR
text: President Trump's doctor says he's no longer contagious 10 days after the onset of symptoms, but did not give details on whether Trump has tested negative for the coronavirus. https://t.co/bi9VsxHfZb

name: NPR
text:
Susan Collins is the last Republican member of Congress from New England. And a combination of controversial votes and increasingly nationalized politics has her locked in the fight of her political career.
 https://t.co/CzR7CejQQI

name: NPR
text:
An estimated 500,000 sharks could be killed if a coronavirus vaccine with shark squalene — an immune-system stimulant harvested from shark livers — proves to be effective, a conservation group warns.
https://t.co/WSq4hFyvS5

name: NPR
text:
The fashion industry is reeling in the pandemic. Marketing budgets have been slashed, and magazines are thinner. But houses have still moved forward with some physical runway shows — and lots more online.
https://t.co/CQYkHSgK5T

name: NPR
text: Chef Sean Sherman, a member of the Oglala Lakota tribe, started Indigenous Food Lab — a nonprofit dedicated to researching wild foods, ethnobotany, native agriculture, seed keeping, farming techniques, medicinals and food preservation. @hereandnow https://t.co/Ld1jPHn66H

name: NPR
text:
We talked to 19 women around the world about their challenges and fears during the pandemic — and how they’re overcoming them.

Here’s what they said.
https://t.co/6mxhdARNWR

name: NPR
text:
The U.S. tax code favors wealthy people who make money from investments, letting them pay taxes at a much lower rate than average people who earn salaries.

Morris Pearl, chair of the group Patriotic Millionaires, is advocating to change that.
https://t.co/GJ45BKRoqd

name: NPR
text: Tiwa Savage's third album 'Celia' celebrates femininity as sensual, empowered and strong. It's her first release since being featured on Beyoncé's The Lion King soundtrack. https://t.co/V3VnKp9fKj

name: NPR
text:
For the past 32 years, LGBTQ Americans have celebrated sharing who they are with family, friends and colleagues on Oct. 11.

Here are two @NPRLifeKit episodes about how to have those conversations — and how to better support the LGBTQ people in your life. https://t.co/PNwZr7SWJg

name: NPR
text:
If someone comes out to you: Listen. You have a responsibility to make space for them.

If you're the one coming out — or considering coming out — remember: You get to choose who to open up to, and when.

This episode focuses on navigating that process: https://t.co/JpZqvedRfA

name: NPR
text:
A few tips for people on both sides of the coming out conversation:

• Make time for the conversation
• Someone sha… https://t.co/gJUVMrgUc9

name: NPR
text:
The Supreme Court ruled this summer that employees can't be fired for being trans, but that doesn't mean that being openly trans at work is easy — or even safe.

This episode talks through ways cis people can support their trans and nonbinary colleagues. https://t.co/WKT1lXyfFs

name: NPR
text:
A few tips for making the workplace more equitable for your trans coworkers:

• Do your own research instead of asking intrusive questions
• Be intentional about your language and correct mistakes
• Look beyond inclusion and push for true equity https://t.co/WKT1lXyfFs

name: NPR
text: Jason Ward is a birder, so @waitwait invited him to play a game called  "Watch these birds, you nefarious pig!" — 3 questions about "Angry Birds," the game in which you throw birds at pigs. https://t.co/AO43XHhhc1

name: NPR
text:
RT @PhilKlay: Really loved doing this interview with @lourdesgnavarro from @NPRWeekend 

https://t.co/DcnLBEjT9G
